result.execSummary:
The defendant Luster Charles Dan Hurt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luster Charles Dan Hurt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Petitioner appeared, pro se.  City of Milwaukee and State of Wisconsin appear by Assistant District Attorney John Daniel Flynn.
Deputy Court Clerk:  CMC.
Hearing on petition of return of property proceeded. Petitioner provided verification. Statements made by  counsel and petitioner.  Court grants petition.  Filed, signed Order.

Petitioner appeared, pro se.  City of Milwaukee and State of Wisconsin appear by Assistant District Attorney John Flynn.
Deputy Court Clerk: CMC.
Hearing on petition of return of property proceeded.  Petitioner needs to provide proof of ownership. Case calendared for Return of Property Hearing in Branch 24.  Return of property hearing scheduled for December 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Luster Charles Dan Hurt in court PRO SE.  Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case heard off the record.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Branch 24 not in session. State does not have file. Case adjourned for Return on Property Hearing in branch 24.  Return of property hearing scheduled for December 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Return of property hearing on November 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Petitioner Luster Charles Dan Hurt in court.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.    
Hearing on petition of return of property proceeded.  Statements made by counsel and petitioner.  Court denies petition.
Return of property hearing on October 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

Defendant Luster Charles Dan Hurt in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered the Defendant to pay a forfeiture of $250.00 OR serve 5 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 5 days TIME SERVED.
Received and filed with court: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form; and a Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

Filed:
*  Notice of Motion, Motion, and Memorandum in Support of Motion to Suppress Evidence of Illegal Stop.

Defendant Luster Charles Dan Hurt in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense requested a motion hearing.  Court ordered defense motion to be filed by April 22, 2015.  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 24.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders criminal complaint amended to reflect correct address of Defendant to 3251 N 40th Street.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Luster Charles Dan Hurt in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Luster Charles Dan Hurt in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Protasiewicz, Br. 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
